titleStmt.title: J. E. Cooper et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10229

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency, Gov. Magoffin of Ky.

Your Petitioners of Rowan Co respectfully Represent unto your Honor. That at Feb. Term 1861, of Rowan Cir. Court John Kissick was fined $ , and Sentences to Six months confinement in the County Jail, for Shooting with a Pistol with intent to kill, a man (Barney Hayden) no injury was done. There is some doubt Whether this Pistol was charged with anything except Powder -- The man was not touched nor in any way injured -- Your Petitioners represent that Said Kissick is a poor man, with a respectable wife & 4 Children, if he Cannot get out to Raise a Crop, his family must Suffer for the ensuing year. Will Your Excellency remit his imprisonment and let him go home to raise his Crop and attend to his family, To the request as above Your Petitioner Will ever pray &c.

March 29th 1861-
Yours &c
J. E. Cooper
Isaac E Johnson J P R C
Jas. W. Johnson S. R. C.
T J F Hargis
Chas A Ward
J P Richards
H. C. Darry
R. R. Evans
A. Keeton C. S. C.
Dixon Clack
John Hargis cty. atto.

Rowan Cir Ct
Jno. Kissick
Acted on
